This vignette represents an introduction to the use of the package G-SS-TDA. 

```{r setup}
library(GSSTDA)
```

Create full data set:
```{r}
num_rows <- 100
full_data <- data.frame( x=2*cos(1:num_rows), y=sin(1:num_rows) )
row.names(full_data) <- 1:num_rows

```

Filter values:
```{r}
filter_values <- c(2*cos(1:num_rows))
names(filter_values) <- row.names(full_data)
```

Create the mapper object with full dataset and the function which filter the dataset.
```{r}
num_intervals <- 5
percent_overlap <- 0.4
distance_type <- "euclidean"
clustering_type <- "hierarchical"
linkage_type <- "single"
num_bins_when_clustering <- 10


mapper_obj <- mapper(full_data, filter_values, num_intervals, percent_overlap, distance_type, clustering_type, num_bins_when_clustering, linkage_type)


```

Obtain information from the mapper object created in the previous step.
```{r}
mapper_infor <- get_information_from_results(mapper_obj)

print(mapper_infor)
```

Plot the mapper graph.
```{r}
plot_mapper(mapper_obj)
```
